examples: every able-bodied young man served in the army

results.definition: have the skills and qualifications to do things well
examples: children as young as 14 can be extremely capable and dependable

results.definition: having inherent physical or mental ability or capacity
examples: human beings are able to walk on two feet
Superman is able to leap tall buildings

results.definition: (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something
examples: she was able to program her computer
we were at last able to buy a car
able to get a grant for the project
